revised_title: Exploring Fluid Transfer Mechanisms in Necturus Gall Bladder Epithelium
tldr: Researchers studied the fluid transfer in Necturus gall bladder epithelium and found that it is an active secretion process. The epithelial cells maintain quasi-isotonic fluid transfer over a wide range of osmolarities. The results suggest that water crosses the epithelium through extracellular routes via intercellular junctions, challenging the standing-gradient osmotic theory.
